intro: Heterothrix gracilis, commonly known as the slender thread moss, is a small, delicate moss species belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its thin, wiry stems and small, elongated leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on soil or rock surfaces in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores when mature. Heterothrix gracilis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for small invertebrates.
